v 1.0:
• First release //Help Dialogs HHS Moodle - short introduction On every screen you can reach a help dialog, by clicking \"Menu -> Help\".

Important
If your moodle username or password gets changed, you must change this also in the settings. It is highly recommended to protect the app with a pin against unwanted access. This and other settings you can reach by pressing \"Menu -> Settings\".

Navigation
You reach the main screen of the app, by clicking the arrow on the left side of the toolbar. By clicking the toolbar you can go either back to the main screen or open your favorite bookmark (you can decide this in the settings). If you long click on the toolbar, the app gets closed completely.

Widgets
You can add a widget to your homescreen, to get a faster access to the main functions of the app (calendar -> offline, My Moodle, bookmarks, notes, create new note). Here your saved bookmarks are shown.

The List:
If you click on a list entry the bookmark opens in the intern browser. If you long click a list entry a popup menu opens. You can change the bookmark icon by clicking on it.

Popup menu:
• Edit title: You can edit the title of the bookmark.
• Set as favorite: If you set a bookmark as favorite, you can open it at the app start or by clicking on the toolbar. You can configure that in the settings.
• Create note: The title of the bookmark will be used as title for a new note, the url for the content.
• Create shortcut: A shortcut to the bookmark will be created on your homescreen.
• Create calendar entry: The name of the bookmark will be used as title for a new calendar entry. Editing of this entry will take place in your calendar app.
• Delete bookmark: At least one bookmark must remain. All others can be deleted.

Menu:
• Create note (pen icon): A new dialog where you can create a new note will open.
• Open app directory: If you have a installed file manager, the directory where downloaded files are stored will open.
• Create shortcut: To have a faster access to the main functions of the app, you can create shortcuts on your homescreen (calendar -> offline, My Moodle, bookmarks, notes, create new note).
• Settings: In the settings you can configure the behavior of the app. It is highly recommended to protect the app with a password against unwanted access.
• Help: Opens the help dialog. Here are bookmarks to important Moodle sites stored. Also a link to our school homepage and to a search engine. This list can not be edited.

• Help: Opens the help dialog. Here your notes are shown. You can create a note, by clicking the menu entry (pen icon).

The list:
If you click on a list entry the note opens in a dialog. If you long click a list entry a popup menu opens. If you click on the circle on the left of a list entry, You can edit the priority of the note.

Popup menu:
• Edit note: A new dialog, where you can edit priority, title and content of the note, will open.
• Share note: You can share the note with every app which is able to receive text (SMS, Email,…).
• Create calendar entry: The name of the note will be used as title for a new calendar entry. Editing of this entry will take place in your calendar app.
• Delete note: At least one note must remain. All others can be deleted.

• Settings: In the settings you can configure the behavior of the app. It is highly recommended to protect the app with a password against unwanted access.
• Help: Opens the help dialog. Settings Some settings need a restart of the app to be applied. Browser HHS Moodle is shown in this browser. There is a context menu, which opens by long clicking a picture or link.

Swipe:
• Swipe down: reload website.
• Swipe right: one page back.
• Swipe left: one page forward.

Menu:
• Create note (pen icon): A new window will popup, where you can create a note. The title of the website is used for the note title. The link is used for the content.
• Open bookmarks (star icon): A popup dialog with your bookmark list will open.
• Add bookmark: Add the actual website to your bookmark list. A popup dialog where you can edit the title of the bookmark will open.
• Share bookmark: You can share the link with every app which is able to receive text (SMS, Email,…). You can also make and share screenshots of the whole website (even from the part, which is not on the screen). With that you should wait until the whole website is loaded, to avoid problems.
• Open app directory: If you have a installed file manager, the directory where downloaded files are stored will open.
